frontmatter.title: UI states
frontmatter.description: UI states are used to inform users about the various states a page or container can be.

internal.content:
--- title: UI states description: UI states are used to inform users about the various states a page or container can be. tabs: ["Usage", "Code"] --- UI states are used to inform users about the various states a page or container can be. There can be 4 possible states for a typical workflow: 1. Loading states 2. Content placeholders 3. Error states 4. Empty states ### Principles * Load progressively. * Skeleton over spinner. * Show a progress bar if loading takes more than 1s. * If the content or data may be empty after loading, use a spinner. * Avoid flicker (showing an element and then removing it).
### Loading state A typical process starts with loading the app first. If we go step by step -
State Content type Loader type
Loading the app Unpredictable Spinner
Loading page template Predictable Skeleton
Making API calls Data can be empty Spinner
Making API calls Data will always be present Skeleton
Searching Data can be empty Spinner
Changing page Data will always be present Skeleton

### Examples #### Loading the app ![Loading the app](./images/uiStates-1.jpg)

#### Loading the page template ![Loading the page template](./images/uiStates-2.jpg)

#### Making API calls - Data can be empty ![Making API calls where data can be empty](./images/uiStates-3.jpg)

#### Making API calls - Data cannot be empty ![Making API calls where data cannot be empty](./images/uiStates-4.jpg)

#### Searching - Data can be empty ![Searching where data can be empty](./images/uiStates-5.jpg)

#### Pagination - Data cannot be empty ![Pagination where data cannot be empty](./images/uiStates-6.jpg)

### Empty and Error States
State Content Card
No content available Blank screen with illustration
Educate the content about this module
Call to action (Create, search, etc) 		No
No search results No results illustration Yes, if previously present
Error (page not loaded) Blank screen with error illustration
Retry button 		No
Error (search/filter/pagination) Toast with the error message and 'Try again' action Yes, if previously present


#### Examples ##### No content available ##### No search results ##### Error (page not loaded) ##### Error (search/filter/pagination)
![Error for search/filter/pagination](./images/uiStates-7.jpg)


### Flowchart ![Flowchart for a typical UI state](./images/uiStates-8.png)
